publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in ŠorčuqStadthöhleduring T III Š 95.12

seg.seg: ... die in the centre; just born, o(thers) ... [80b]
... is (not) one, that was immortal. [80d] Like ...
... (and [to] all) beings (born) death is always ... [81b]
... one [still] seen in the morning, [81a] in the morning also ...
... [those] of middle years [and] also [those] that are young [82a] ...
... the foolish being must have trust: “I am young. (I will not die yet)” ... [82c]
... like the ripe fruit these young ones great ... [83a]
... fall all also, they have been ripped off. [83b] Therefore ...
... (all) went into destruction. [83d] The foolish beings ...
... they laugh, they play, they trust: life [is] eternal ... [84b]
... sie [scil. die törichten Wesen] lachen, sie spielen, sie haben das Vertrauen: Ewig [ist] das Leben ...
... they [i.e. the foolish beings] laugh, they play, they trust: life [is] eternal ...
... (and when de)ath (suddenly comes to them), it severs their bonds. [84d] ...
... A brahmin named (Jāti)śroṇa (came) in the arisen ... [85b]
... o God, sever the doubt that has arisen (in) my spirit. [85c]
... in the countries and villages immorality has turned up (among) the beings. [86b]
... the brothers’ wives are being touched, the sisters, the daughters [86c] ...
Die Frauen der Brüder werden berührt, die Schwestern, die Töchter ...
The brothers' wives are being touched, the sisters, the daughters ...
... [86d] (When the kings) out of insatiability lead the army (into) other (countries) ... [87a]

p.note: Contains fragments of strophes 80b – 87a1, thereby supplementing the verso side of .
The original manuscript is missing, but had a torn-off right corner, about 1/4 of a leaf.
k= ā(lyaik) supplemented according to II, 4 fn. 3.
mā and mä(kte) supplemented according to 140.
(po tetemo)ṣäṃts supplemented according to II, 4 fn. 6.
ra(no) supplemented according to II, 4 fn. 7.
maiwe(ño) emended according to I, 9 fn. 7.
(spä)ntoyträ emended according to I, 9 fn. 8; (nesau māwk ñäś srūkalle) supplemented based on b2.
Against II, 4 the translation without mā 'not' is warranted by the Sanskrit Udv. I a8.
The beginning of the line might be supplemented by (poñc yeyeṃ) according to supplemented according to II, 4 fn. 11.
(sruka)lñe emended according to I, 9 fn. 12 based on b5.
The personal name (jāti)śroṇe is emended according to I, 9 fn. 13 based on a2.
(ña)kta and palsko(ne) emended according to I, 10 fn. 1.
wnolme(ntsa) emended according to I, 10 fn. 2.
(lāñc) is supplemented based on b8 and ret(k)e iyaṃ (yp)au(nane) based on a1.

div.head: Sanskrit parallel
div.p: corresponds to Uv. I, 7: sāyam eke na dṛśyante kālyaṃ dṛṣṭā mahājanāḥ kālyaṃ caike na dṛṣyante sāyaṃ dṛṣṭā mahājanāḥ
In the evening not many beings are seen, at day break they are seen, at day brake they are not seen, but in the evening they are seen.
corresponds to Uv. I, 10: ye ca vṛddhā ye ca dahrā ye ca madhyamapūruṣāḥ anupūrvaṃ pravrajanti phalaṃ pakvaṃ va bandhanāt
Some are grown, some are small, some are mediocre beings, orderly they go like ripe fruit from the bond.
corresponds to Uv. I, 8: tatra ko viśvasen martyo daharo ’smīti jīvite
I am young (but) mortal. Who is there in this life that could rely on (something)?
corresponds to Uv. I, 11: yathā phalānāṃ pakvānāṃ nityaṃ patanato bhayam
As ripe fruits always are in fear of falling.

list.item:
Transcription

a1. k= ā(lyaik) supplemented according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: II, 4 fn. 3.
a2. mā and mä(kte) supplemented according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 140.
a3. (po tetemo)ṣäṃts supplemented according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: II, 4 fn. 6.
a4. ra(no) supplemented according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: II, 4 fn. 7.
a5. maiwe(ño) emended according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: I, 9 fn. 7.
a6. (spä)ntoyträ emended according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: I, 9 fn. 8; (nesau māwk ñäś srūkalle) supplemented based on [[THT 1]] b2.
a7. (tai)we emended according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 141.
a8. (klo)yonträ emended according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: I, 9 fn. 10.
b1. The beginning of the line might be supplemented by (poñc yeyeṃ) according to supplemented according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: II, 4 fn. 11.
b2. (ke)ry(e)ṃ emended according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: I, 9 fn. 11.
b3. (sruka)lñe emended according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: I, 9 fn. 12 based on [[THT 1]] b5.
b4. The personal name (jāti)śroṇe is emended according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: I, 9 fn. 13 based on [[THT 3]] a2.
b5. (ña)kta and palsko(ne) emended according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: I, 10 fn. 1.
b6. wnolme(ntsa) emended according to [[TochSprR(B) I]]: I, 10 fn. 2.
b8. (lāñc) is supplemented based on [[THT 1]] b8 and ret(k)e iyaṃ (yp)au(nane) based on [[THT 3]] a1.

Translation

a6. Against [[TochSprR(B) I]]: II, 4 the translation without mā 'not' is warranted by the Sanskrit Udv. I a8.

General remarks

Contains fragments of strophes 80b – 87a1, thereby supplementing the verso side of [[THT 1]].

a1 /// [y]wārcä\ srukent_r_a tet[e]moṣ k= ā /// a2 /// sū ne_s_aṃ k_use onwaññe tākoyä\ 80 _m_a a3 /// [_ṣ_a]ṃt_s\ onolmeṃt_s\ srukalñe ṣ[_p]\ ṣe_k\ a4 /// tsoṅkai_k\ lyelyku ksa : tsoṅkaik ra a5 /// [y]wārśkāññi pik_ulameṃ k_use rano maiwe a6 /// ntoyt_r_a wnolmi aknātsa maiwe a7 /// we menā_k\ ce maiweñä\ wrocce a8 /// yont_r_a no ponta _r_aṣyeṃnt_r_a man_t\ b1 /// nkelñene 80-3 wnolmi aknātsañä\ b2 /// [r]y·ṃ kāñmeṃ s_p_anteṃnt_r_a onwaññe śau_l\ b3 /// lñe _k_arsnān-m= eṅkalñenta 80-4 b4 /// śroṇe ñe_m\ brāhmaṇe t_s_aṅko_ṣ\ b5 /// kta pkrāsta sklo_k\ ñi t_s_aṅkoṣ palsko b6 /// ypauna k_uṣaintsa kaklautkau aṅkāre wnolme b7 /// pr[o]_t_arñt_sä\ śnona ysen_t_a_r\ ṣera tkā_t_arñä\ b8 /// [o]ntsoyttñesa alloṅkna re[t]·e [i]yaṃ ·au

Sanskrit parallel

a4. corresponds to Uv. I, 7:
sāyam eke na dṛśyante kālyaṃ dṛṣṭā mahājanāḥ
kālyaṃ caike na dṛṣyante sāyaṃ dṛṣṭā mahājanāḥ


In the evening not many beings are seen, at day break they are seen, at day brake they are not seen, but in the evening they are seen.


a5. corresponds to Uv. I, 10:
ye ca vṛddhā ye ca dahrā ye ca madhyamapūruṣāḥ
anupūrvaṃ pravrajanti phalaṃ pakvaṃ va bandhanāt


Some are grown, some are small, some are mediocre beings, orderly they go like ripe fruit from the bond.


a6. corresponds to Uv. I, 8:
tatra ko viśvasen martyo daharo ’smīti jīvite


I am young (but) mortal. Who is there in this life that could rely on (something)?


a7. corresponds to Uv. I, 11:
yathā phalānāṃ pakvānāṃ nityaṃ patanato bhayam


As ripe fruits always are in fear of falling.

a1 /// ywārc srukenträ tetemoṣ_(Pl.)|tetemoṣ k= alyaik|ā(lyaik) /// #80b a2 /// %2 (mā) sū nesäṃ_(Sg.)|nesäṃ ; k_use onuwaññe|onwaññe tākoy 80 #80d mäkte|mä|(kte) a3 /// (po tetemo)ṣäṃts onolmeṃts srukalñe ṣp ṣek a4 /// #81b %16 tsoṅkaik lyelyaku|lyelyku ksa : #81a tsoṅkaik rano|ra|(no) a5 /// %8 ; ywārśkāññi pik_ulameṃ ; k_use rano maiweñ|maiwe|(ño) a6 #82a /// %1 (spä)ntoyträ , onolme|wnolm{e} aknātsa ; maiwe a7 (nesau māwk , ñäś srūkalle) #82c /// (tai)we menāk ce maiweñ orocce|wrocce a8 /// #83a %12 (klo)yonträ ; no ponta räṣyentär|räṣyeṃnträ #83b mant b1 /// %17 #83c %7 ; (poñc yeyeṃ) nkelñene 83 #83d onolmi|wnolmi aknātsañ b2 /// %16 #84a (ke)ry(e)ṃ kāñmeṃ spänteṃnträ onuwaññe|onwaññe śaul b3 /// #84b %4 (sruka)lñe ; kärsnān-me|kärsnān-m= eṅkalñenta 84 #84d b4 /// %21 #85a (jāti)śroṇe ñem brāhmaṇe tsäṅkoṣ #85b b5 /// (ña)kta pkrāsta sklok ñi tsäṅkoṣ palskone|palsko|(ne) b6 #85c /// ypauna k_uṣaintsa kaklautkau aṅkāre onolmentsa|wnolme|(ntsa) b7 #86b /// protärñts śnona ysentär ṣera tkātärñ #86c b8 /// #86d (lāñc) ontsoyttñesa alloṅkna ret(k)e iyaṃ ypaunane|(yp)au|(nane) #87a
The original manuscript is missing, but had a torn-off right corner, about 1/4 of a leaf.

Alternative classifications:
Peyrot–
Malzahn–
TamaiII-3 (800-900)
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]

b7 Die Frauen der Brüder werden berührt, die Schwestern, die Töchter ... 246

"b8 ... [87d] (When the kings)" changed to "b8 ... [86d] (When the kings)". –Martin (Sat, 2014-08-02, 19:23:37)

Da der rechte Rand offensichtlich erhalten ist, habe ich die Zeilenumbrüche so korrigiert, dass die Rekonstruktionen dort stehen, wo auch mal Papier war. Bitte um Nachricht per E-Mail, falls etwas anderes beschlossen wurde. –Martin (Fri, 2015-01-23, 06:35:58)

A brahmin named (Jāti)śroṇa (came) in the arisen ... [85b] b5 ... o God, sever the doubt that has arisen (in) my spirit. [85c] b6 ... in the countries and villages immorality has turned up (among) the beings. [86b] b7 ... the brothers’ wives are being touched, the sisters, the daughters [86c] ... b8 ... [86d] (When the kings) out of insatiability lead the army (into) other (countries) ... [87a]
